field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Richard Leo Enos is Professor and Lillian B. Radford Chair of Rhetoric and Composition at Texas Christian University. A historian of classical rhetoric, much of his work deals with thought and expression in Antiquity. In 2006, he received the George E. Yoos Distinguished Service Award by the Rhetoric Society of America. He currently serves on the Managing Committee of The American School of Classical Studies at Athens. He received a 2007 “Deans’ Research and Creative Activity Award” from Texas Christian University, the 2008 “Chancellor’s Award for Distinguished Achievement as a Creative Teacher and Scholar,” and is the 2009 Piper Professor for the State of Texas. r.enos@tcu.edu
